thread.title: Restaurant Report Card: 10.15.15 Buffalo Wild Wings
thread.title_full: Restaurant Report Card: 10.15.15 Buffalo Wild Wings

author: 13abc
title: Restaurant Report Card: 10.15.15 Buffalo Wild Wings
text:
PERRYSBURG (13abc Action News) - If gnats are buzzing around your restaurant's kitchen, you'd better get rid of them. Because if they're still there when a health inspector comes back, it's a violation.
They did get rid of them at Buffalo Wild Wings on North Dixie Highway in Perrysburg.
The first time health inspectors were here, they noted 14 violations, including 6 critical.
For example: Gnats in the kitchen; Build up on the toaster oven, ice tea brewer and sauce dispensers; Person-In-Charge was unable to demonstrate proper knowledge of food safety.
Since that Standard Health Inspection by the Wood County Health District, a sanitarian has returned for a follow-up and brought the overall number down to 7.
In a statement, the director of operations for this Buffalo Wild Wings in Perrysburg writes: "We have worked diligently to correct these violations. Our top priority is the satisfaction and safety of our customers ...The upkeep and cleanliness of our restaurant is of the utmost importance and we will continue our work to deliver the best quality, service, cleanliness and value to our customers each day."
